add_location.message.1: The basemap has already been set. If you want to set a new basemap, the existing basemap will be overwritten. Do you want to set a new basemap?
add_location.message.4:
Select an OpenStreetMap (.osm) file to use as the basemap. You can download an OSM file from openstreetmap.org; see the manual for further help.
Setting a new basemap may take a long time if the file is large.
set_resolution.message.1: Set the resolution in meters. For further details see manual.
set_resolution.message.2: The resolution value has to be a positive integer.
set_resolution.message.7: No valid basemap found. Please set the basemap in the settings menu.
set_selection.message.1: No valid basemap found. Please set the basemap in the settings menu.
set_selection.message.2:
A ‘selection’ is a selected part of the basemap area. Calculations will only be performed for that selection. Use the polygon tool to set the selection. When you have finished drawing, click ‘Save’ to set your drawing as selection.
The selection area has to overlap with the basemap boundary.
add_map.message.1: No valid basemap found. Please set the basemap in the settings menu.
add_map.message.2: Choose a file to import as a new layer. Only GeoPackage, GeoJSON, OSM and GeoTIFF files are allowed. Depending on the file size, this process may take some time.
add_map.message.3: Choose a name for the new layer. The name has to start with a letter and may only contain letters, numbers and underscores.
add_map.message.4: The layer has been added successfully.
add_map.errors.1: Wrong file format - must be one of 'geojson', 'gpkg', 'osm', 'tif', 'tiff', 'gtif'
add_map.errors.2: Invalid map name. Use alphanumeric characters only
time_map.message.1:
A start point is required. Use the circlemarker tool to draw a start point.
The start point must be located inside the selection area.
time_map.message.2:
Optionally one via point can be added. If you want to add a via point, draw a point using the circlemarker tool and click ‘Save’.
The via point must be located inside the selection area.
time_map.message.3:
Defining an affected area is optional. An affected area is an area where the travel speed is reduced by, e.g., a natural disaster, flooding, or mass event. If you want to add an affected area, draw a closed area using the polygon tool and click ‘Save’.
The affected area must be located inside the selection area.
time_map.message.4:
Set the speed reduction ratio (in percent) for roads in the affected area.
E.g. a value of 40 will set the speed to 40 % of the normal speed.
time_map.message.6:
Time map output is ready.
To display the results, you can activate the layer ‘road-level time map’ in the layer switcher and/or click on the Results button in the top bar and select the latest time map PDF.
time_map.message.7: No valid basemap found. Please set the basemap in the settings menu.
time_map.message.8:
Average speed values are used for the different road types of the area. Do you want to change them?
In case you want to calculate the time map for walking or cycling, you can set the average speed value to:
  • Walking: 5 km/h
  • Cycling: 12 km/h
time_map.message.9: Set the average speed for different road types in km/h.
time_map.message.10: Please set the resolution first (in the settings menu).
time_map.message.11: Please set a selection first (in the settings menu).
time_map.output.1: Map output for time map calculations
time_map.output.3: Colors on map represent time in minutes
time_map.output.4: Numbers in legend represent time in minutes
time_map.output.9: Speed reduction coefficient for stricken area
query.message.1: Please set a selection first (in the settings menu).
query.message.2: Choose the map layer you want to query.
query.message.3: Define the query using the form and press ‘OK’.
query.message.7: No valid basemap found. Please set the basemap in the settings menu.
query.message.24:
Query output is ready.
To display the result, click on the Results button in the top bar and select the latest query PDF.
tooltip:time map: The ‘Calculate time map’ module creates a map showing the time it takes to reach any part of the selected area from a given start point. Optionally, via points and/or affected areas with reduced speed can be defined.
tooltip:query: The ‘Query area’ module lets you filter map features based on a given set of constraints. For example, if a housing map layer is queried based on the household population and monthly income, only the houses within the given range will be returned.
error:file upload: Please choose a file to upload.
error:draw point: Please draw a point using the circlemarker drawing tool.
error:draw polygon: Please draw a polygon using the polygon drawing tool.
error:name: Please enter a name.
error:form numbers: Please enter valid numbers in the fields.
